intro: Both gateways work. In summer, Salerno often wins quietly thanks to extra ferries and calmer queues.

sections.title: When Salerno wins
body: Seasonal ferries run direct to Positano or Amalfi with lighter crowds than Naples piers.
Pair Salerno Costa d'Amalfi (QSR) airport with the Airlink shuttle to keep transfers simple.

sections.title: When Naples wins
body: Off-season reliability: high-speed trains plus SITA via Sorrento keep running when ferries pause.
Late arrivals find more accommodation and onward transport choices around Naples.

sections.title: Luggage & stairs
body: Arrive at Chiesa Nuova to minimise stairs up to the hostel.
Landing by ferry? Book a porter at the dock or ride the SITA bus uphill instead of hauling bags.

a: Increasingly yes for summer: combine QSR flights with the Airlink shuttle and ferry when seas are calm, and fall back to buses if weather turns.
